description: Penguins are flightless seabirds adapted to cold marine environments with specialised flippers for swimming.
They feed primarily on fish, squid and krill and breed in colonies.
Panther is a common name often used for large melanistic (or non-melanistic) big cats such as leopards or jaguars.
They are adaptable predators occupying forests and grasslands.
Porcupines are rodents with a coat of sharp quills used for defence and are primarily herbivorous.
They inhabit forests and grasslands and feed on vegetation.
Puffins are small seabirds with colourful bills that dive for fish and nest on coastal cliff ledges and islands.
They feed primarily on small fish and often carry multiple fish crosswise in their bills.
Pythons are non-venomous constrictor snakes found in Africa, Asia and Australia that feed on mammals and birds.
They are ambush predators that swallow prey whole.
